movies.title: Corto Maltese: La maison dorée de Samarkand
movies.plot: Hugo Pratt's famous comics adventurer, Corto Maltese while sojourning in Adana, Turkey, discovers a map to the treasure of Cyrus, an ancient king of Persia. To assist him in his quest, he enlists his old friend/nemesis the unbelievable Raspoutine whom he first has to help escape from the prison of Samarkand (aka "La maison dorée de Samarkand", the golden house of Samarkand). On the long and tortured way to the riches, he encounters all kind of interesting characters, soldiers of fortune, lost British actors, and even his doppelgänger.
movies.simplePlot: In 1921, laconic adventurer Corto Maltese is in Turkey where several armed factions fight for control. He finds a map to a lost Persian treasure there. He'll need his friend Rasputin who's in Samarkand prison run by Corto's double.

biography.bio: Richard Berry was born on July 31, 1950 in Paris, France as Richard Élie Benguigui. He is an actor and writer, known for L'immortel (2010), Ruby & Quentin (2003) and The Valet (2006). He has been married to Pascale Louange since September 17, 2016. They have one child. He was previously married to Jessica Forde and Jeane Manson.
biography.name: Richard Berry

biography.bio: Patrick Bouchitey was born on August 11, 1946 in Plancher-les-Mines, Haute-Saône, France. He is an actor and writer, known for La meilleure façon de marcher (1976), Lune froide (1991) and La tête en friche (2010).
biography.name: Patrick Bouchitey

biography.bio: Catherine Jacob was born on December 16, 1956 in Paris, France. She is an actress and writer, known for Tatie Danielle (1990), Livide (2011) and Mon Pere Ce Heros (1991).
biography.name: Catherine Jacob
